part_name: Immigration Rules Appendix VIP Delegate Visa

metadata.source: Immigration Rules Appendix VIP Delegate Visa
metadata.part: Immigration Rules Appendix VIP Delegate Visa
metadata.section_title: Entry requirements for a VIP Delegate

chunks.text:
### Entry requirements for a VIP Delegate

DEL 1.1. A person seeking to come to the UK as a VIP Delegate must apply for and obtain entry clearance before they arrive in the UK.

metadata.source: Immigration Rules Appendix VIP Delegate Visa
metadata.part: Immigration Rules Appendix VIP Delegate Visa
metadata.section_title: Validity requirements for entry clearance as a VIP Delegate

chunks.text:
### Validity requirements for entry clearance as a VIP Delegate

DEL 2.1. A person applying for entry clearance as a VIP Delegate must apply online on the gov.uk website on the specified form: [“A exempt, diplomatic, official visit vignette or S2 Healthcare Visitor visa”](https://www.gov.uk/exempt-vignette).

1.   DEL 2.2. An application for entry clearance as a VIP Delegate must satisfy all the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) the applicant must be named in a Note Verbale provided by their government, confirming that they are part of the official delegation accompanying their Head of State or serving government Minister; and
    2.   (b) the applicant must have provided a valid passport which satisfactorily establishes their identity and nationality; and
    3.   (c) the applicant must provide a facial image in accordance with the application process, and which complies with the rules for digital photos on [“https://www.gov.uk/photos-for-passports”](https://www.gov.uk/photos-for-passports); and
    4.   (d) the applicant must be aged 18 or older on the date of application.

DEL 2.3. An application for entry clearance as a VIP Delegate must be made while the applicant is outside the UK and to a Visa Application Centre (VAC) designated to accept such applications.

DEL 2.4. An application which does not meet all the validity requirements for a VIP Delegate may be rejected as invalid and not considered.

metadata.source: Immigration Rules Appendix VIP Delegate Visa
metadata.part: Immigration Rules Appendix VIP Delegate Visa
metadata.section_title: Suitability requirements for a VIP Delegate

chunks.text:
### Suitability requirements for a VIP Delegate

DEL 3.1. The decision maker must be satisfied that the applicant should not be refused under Part Suitability.

metadata.source: Immigration Rules Appendix VIP Delegate Visa
metadata.part: Immigration Rules Appendix VIP Delegate Visa
metadata.section_title: Eligibility requirements for a VIP Delegate

chunks.text:
### Eligibility requirements for a VIP Delegate

1.   DEL 4.1. The decision maker must be satisfied that the applicant meets the following eligibility requirements: 
    1.   (a) the applicant is visiting the UK with the intention and sole purpose of accompanying their Head of State or serving government Minister on official business of their government; and
    2.   (b) the applicant is a government official; and
    3.   (c) the applicant’s intended dates of travel are consistent with the dates of the official visit; and
    4.   (d) the applicant is aged 18 or older.

DEL 4.2. The decision maker must be satisfied that the Note Verbale referred to in DEL 2.2(a) meets all the eligibility requirements in DEL 4.3. to DEL 4.6.

1.   DEL 4.3. The Note Verbale must: 
    1.   (a) be issued by the government of the country sending the delegation; and
    2.   (b) not contain a list of names that exceeds the allocated cap per visit.

1.   DEL 4.4. The cap per visit referred to in DEL 4.3(b) is: 
    1.   (a) for delegations accompanying a head of state – 20; and
    2.   (b) for delegations accompanying a serving government minister – 10.

1.   DEL 4.5. The Note Verbale must also contain the following information: 
    1.   (a) the applicant’s name, date of birth and passport number; and
    2.   (b) confirmation of the title and purpose of the official visit and the dates that the official visit will take place; and
    3.   (c) confirmation that the application is supported by the country sending the delegation; and
    4.   (d) confirmation that the applicant has sufficient funds to cover all reasonable costs in relation to their visit without unauthorised working or accessing public funds.

DEL 4.6. The Note Verbale must have been issued prior to the application date and must not have been withdrawn after the issue date.

metadata.source: Immigration Rules Appendix VIP Delegate Visa
metadata.part: Immigration Rules Appendix VIP Delegate Visa
metadata.section_title: Decision on an application as a VIP Delegate

chunks.text:
### Decision on an application as a VIP Delegate

DEL 5.1. If the decision maker is satisfied the suitability and eligibility requirements for entry clearance as a VIP Delegate are met, the application will be granted, otherwise the application will be refused.

metadata.source: Immigration Rules Appendix VIP Delegate Visa
metadata.part: Immigration Rules Appendix VIP Delegate Visa
metadata.section_title: Period of grant for a VIP Delegate

chunks.text:
### Period of grant for a VIP Delegate

DEL 6.1. Entry clearance as a VIP Delegate will be granted for the period beginning three days before the commencement of the official visit to the UK and ending three days after the end of the official visit to the UK and must not exceed in any case the maximum period of one month.

metadata.source: Immigration Rules Appendix VIP Delegate Visa
metadata.part: Immigration Rules Appendix VIP Delegate Visa
metadata.section_title: Conditions of grant for a VIP Delegate

chunks.text:
### Conditions of grant for a VIP Delegate

1.   DEL 7.1. The grant will be subject to all the following conditions: 
    1.   (a) no access to public funds; and
    2.   (b) no work for purposes other than directly related to the purpose of their official visit as stated in the Note Verbale; and
    3.   (c) no study.
